item.title: Christopher add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Edmond Rostand
item.description: "A kiss is a secret which takes the lips for the ear." -- Edmond Rostand

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "What I mean by an educated taste is someone who has the same tastes that I have." -- Edward Albee

item.title: Christopher add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then â€” to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn." -- T.H. White

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "There must have been a moment, at the beginning, were we could have said -- no. But somehow we missed it. " -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "A writer only begins a book. A reader finishes it." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Christopher add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I am circling around God, around the ancient tower, and I have been circling for a thousand years, and I still don't know if I am a falcon, or a storm, or a great song." -- Rainer Maria Rilke
